meanings.definition: An act of improving or repairing something by making small changes or additions.
meanings.sent1: I gave my painting a touchup by adding a few more details.
meanings.sent2: She went to the salon for a touchup on her hair color.
meanings.sent3: The touchup on the old car made it look brand new.
meanings.sent4: A touchup of kindness can make a big difference in someone's day.
meanings.sent5: The touchup on the cake with extra frosting made it irresistible.

meanings.definition: A small amount of cosmetic work done to improve the appearance of something.
meanings.sent1: The photographer did a touchup on the model's photo to remove blemishes.
meanings.sent2: She applied a touchup of lipstick before going out.
meanings.sent3: The touchup on the painting made it look more vibrant.
meanings.sent4: A touchup of paint can make an old piece of furniture look new.
meanings.sent5: The touchup on the dress with added sequins made it sparkle.

meanings.definition: To improve or repair something by making small changes or additions.
meanings.sent1: I need to touchup the paint on the wall where it's chipped.
meanings.sent2: He decided to touchup his resume before applying for the job.
meanings.sent3: She quickly touchuped the essay before submitting it.
meanings.sent4: A touchup of creativity can enhance any project.
meanings.sent5: The artist touchuped the portrait to capture the subject's essence.
